The faithfull scout giving an alarme to Yorkeshire, (especially to the East-Ryding) and all other places at this time freed from the misery of warre, or, A treatise tending to stirre up men from security which possesses them, because (as they thinke) all danger is past, now that the seat of warre is removed from them / written by Will. Meeke. Meeke, William.
[2], 113, [4] p.
by Tho. Broad, and are to be sold by Nathanniel Brookes in London ..., Printed at Yorke [Yorkshire] : 1647.
Includes bibliographical references. Errata: p. [1] at end. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======

by Tho. Broad, and are to be sold by Nathanniel Brookes in London ..., Printed at Yorke [Yorkshire] : 1647.
